description: Mobile & UX Polish Sprint - Fix mobile header layout, improve translation overlay behavior, polish example sentence spacing, and redesign audio mode button for better UX

userStories.title: Mobile header layout broken
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the header layout to work correctly so that I can access theme switcher, settings, and have a clean interface without the help button cluttering the view.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme switcher positioned correctly in mobile view
Settings button accessible in mobile view
Help '?' button hidden in mobile view
Header layout consistent with desktop behavior where appropriate
Test on multiple mobile viewport sizes
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP (mobile viewport)

userStories.title: Translation disappears when scrolling with arrows
userStories.description: As a user learning vocabulary, I want translation overlays to persist when I scroll through card text with arrow keys so that I can keep reference to word meanings while reading.
acceptanceCriteria: Translation overlay persists when scrolling with arrow keys
Scrolling behavior is smooth and doesn't interfere with translation
Alternative solution acceptable: Translation gracefully hides/shows based on scroll state
Test with keyboard arrow keys in both mobile and desktop views
Test with translation mode enabled on cards with scrollable text
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP

userStories.title: Audio mode button UX improvements
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audio mode button to be self-explanatory so that I understand what it does without requiring explanation or documentation.
acceptanceCriteria: STEP 1: Generate 5 distinct solution approaches with visual design, interaction pattern, pros/cons, and implementation complexity
STEP 2: Evaluate each solution against: self-explanatory, clear visual states, consistent with UI patterns, mobile-friendly, implementation effort
STEP 3: Select best solution and document reasoning for choice and why alternatives were rejected
Button purpose is self-explanatory without explanation
Icon states are clear and not visually overwhelming
Avoid red color for disabled state (current issue: red prohibition symbol creates negative feeling)
Remove confusion between 'play audio' button vs 'mode toggle' (current issue: users think green speaker = play)
Consider solutions: different label/icon, toggle with clear states, tooltips, icon+label, mode selector UI
Document all 5 solutions and selection reasoning in implementation notes
Test both active (audio mode ON) and inactive (translation mode ON) states
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP (mobile and desktop)

userStories.title: Example spacing edge cases in D→W cards
userStories.description: As a learner, I want consistent spacing and visual markers for example sentences so that I can easily identify and read examples regardless of text length.
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent spacing for example sentences in all card layouts (D→W, W→D, etc.)
Vertical pipe marker present for all examples (currently missing in D→W layout)
Adequate margin/padding on both sides (fix: first line narrow ~7%, second line excessive ~60%)
Visual consistency with other card types (reference: 2000NL-038 completed work)
Multi-line wrapped examples have balanced spacing (not ragged)
Single-line examples maintain current acceptable appearance
Test with both short and long example sentences
Test specifically in Definition→Word (D→W) card layout
Typecheck passes: npx tsc --noEmit
Verify in browser using Chrome DevTools MCP
